required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efgartigimod Co-administered Subcutaneously With rHuPH20 in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Open-label, Parallel-group Trial to Investigate the Pharmacodynamics, Pharmacokinetics, Safety, and Tolerability of Different Single Subcutaneous Dose Levels of Efgartigimod Co-administered With rHuPH20 in Healthy Adult Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this trial is to investigate the pharmacodynamic (PD), pharmacokinetic (PK), safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of efgartigimod co-administered with rHuPH20, and to measure the time to inject the full dose of investigational medicinal product (IMP) of different dose levels of efgartigimod co-administered with a fixed concentration of rHuPH20 by the subcutaneous (SC) route of administration in healthy adult male subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: IgG levels of four different subcutaneous dose levels
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 11 weeks, from study start until the end of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum serum concentrations (Cmax) of four different subcutaneous dose levels of efgartigimod co-administered with rHuPH20
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 11 weeks, from study start until the end of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to reach maximum serum concentrations (Tmax) of four different subcutaneous dose levels of efgartigimod co-administered with rHuPH20
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 11 weeks, from study start until the end of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under The Curve (AUC) of four different subcutaneous dose levels of efgartigimod co-administered with rHuPH20
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 11 weeks, from study start until the end of the study
Up to 11 weeks, from study start until the end of the study
Up to 11 weeks, from study start until the end of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Time required to administer the different doses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 11 weeks, from study start until the end of the study

arm_group.description: Single SC injection of Dose A
Single SC injection of Dose B
Single SC injection of Dose C
Single SC injection of Dose D

intervention.description: subcutaneous administration of efgartigimod with recombinant human hyaluronidase PH20 (rHuPH20)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject is male, between 18 to 70 years of age
2. Subject is healthy
3. Subject has a body mass index (BMI) between 18 kg/m2 to 30 kg/m2
4. Subject is willing and able to understand the purpose and risks of the trial and provide signed and dated informed consent,
5. Others as defined in the protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Previous participation in clinical trials with efgartigimod and/or any products with rHuPH20.
2. Known hypersensitivity to IMP ingredients or history of a severe allergic or anaphylactic reaction to any drug as determined by the investigator.
3. Known seropositivity or positive test at screening for an active viral infection with Hepatitis B virus (HBV), Hepatitis C virus (HCV), Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).
4. Known clinically relevant immunological disorders.
5. Known history or any symptom of clinically significant illness in the 6 months before IMP administration.
6. Others as defined in the protocol
